Stop reading the reviews and just buy this book. It's the best book I've ever read, so that's saying something. This can only accurately be described as a non-dystopian dystopian book. The protagonist is not sexy, not rebellious. He is just trying to find a simple Easter egg. A awesome plot and a thrilling conclusion, I'll be waiting for the movie adaptation.

As a child of the 80's this book was a ton of fun.  As someone who just enjoys reading, this book was twelve thousand tons of fun.  It's a fun adventure story with well written characters and just enough 80's nostalgia to make it perfect.  My favorite book of the year, and it looks like it's might be destined to become one of my top 10 favorites of all time.

Fantastic novel about a shy, lonely boy learning that his boyhood hero has died and realizing that his hero has programmed a virtual reality Easter egg hunt where you can win millions of dollars by solving clues. Friends become rivals and shady underlings make the story fast paced and surprises along the way. A must for technology savvy readers. 5 out of 5.

This game totally geeked me out. It brought back such awesome memories of when I was a kid playing Atari and Nintendo games. I highly recommend for those interested though to pick up the Audio book read by Will Weaton, it's so awesome. If you were a video game fan as a kid (or still are now) buy this book (and listen to the audio book). You won't regret it.

Fantastic fun for anybody who can remember the 80s geek subculture. The writing isn't going to win any literary awards and could have used a few more doses of "show don't tell" advice from the author's editor but that's only a marginal distraction. Near future sci-fi is one of the hardest genres to write for yet Ernest hits a home run with Ready Player One.

Ernie Cline takes the reader to the future to skillfully send them on a magical journey back to the past. Even as someone who lived through the era that was heavily referenced in the story, I was amazed by the amount of research the author had to do in order to capture the time in all of its geeky pop-culture wonder. Ready Player One is a true page-turner.

I don't read books ever. the last one I read was back in high school 11 years ago. when my friend said the I had to read this book because it wasn't like any other book out there I hesitated. it was only 3.99 @ the time so I thought why not? it only took me 3 days to read because I couldn't put it down. different is right  and I loved every moment of it!!!

I would have to say that Ready Player One is one of the few good novels I have read this year. The amount of references to the eighties and all things geek in this novel actually made me feel like I was a part of the story. Also, the characters seemed to be interesting and real. The far future is bleak, but Oasis is not. I definitely can't wait for Armada.

Ready Player One starts out a little slow, but boy does it really pick up. The 80's references were wonderfully integrated into this story. The dynamics between two of the characters reminded me of the relationship between Crash and Burn in the movie Hackers. This made the characters a little easier to envision.  I would highly recommend reading this book.

I couldn't put this down.  Read over the course of 2 days mostly during commute or just stuck awake reading it late into the night. I found the author and editors spent an amazing amount of time going over the details.  Having grown up in the tail end of the gaming culture of the 80s, I was finding it hard not to recall everything I've experienced myself.

The simplest review I can give is "I loved this book." I can't think of another work of fiction that got "nerd" humor and references as correct as Ready Player One. Cline creates a great cast of characters that are entertaining through to the very end - so much so that you won't want to read those last few pages because the story will be over. Buy it now!

As a child of the 80's, I loved this book. From the moment Wade first spoke his passphrase to log into the OASIS, I knew Ready Player One would be a good read. Some of the writing could have used a little wordsmithery, but it was still good. The plot was not only great, but it was well thought through and expertly executed. I will read more Ernest Cline.

I am a video game developer and found Ready Player One hard to put down. I'm not as geeky as Wade Watts and I'm not familiar with all of the pop culture references, but this did not stop me from enjoying the heck out of this book. The descriptive writing sucks you into the digital world of the oasis where the future world decides to live out their lives.

This was a great read from start to finish, the story while taking place far in the future was startlingly relatable and the pop culture references acted like inside jokes between the author and the reader. This book also gave me hope for the future, all knowledge can be important if used correctly and maybe one day my love of the 80s will come in handy.

I have read and reread this book since a friend recommended it to me. I would classify this as a "romp". I thought the premise was really clever and nothing in Cline's writing kicked off my "Bad Writing/Poor Editing" hinkie-meter. I love the characters, the pacing of the plot, and the happy ending. You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll hurl.

I just finished listening to the Ready Player One book on my ipod. You know a book is good when you are sad that it is over! My favorite books are always the ones that create unique worlds for me to envision. Ready Player One definitely creates a unique world and captured my mind's eye. Definitely recommend this book! Good pace; good plot; good ending.

Absoluely recommend this book. I started reading it for a book club, and I admit, I don't read a lot of sci-fi books. I felt like it started a little slow, but setting the scene really mattered, and once things started going down, I couldn't put it down. The book has a great plot and great characters, but it also has a lot of messages for our society.

If you grew up in the '80s playing q*bert on your friend's atari 2600 - then this is a must read.  A friend of mine nagged and nagged me to read this book, the second I got around to finishing it - I realized why.  The book is AWESOME.  So if you recall big hair, MTV (when it still had music on it), and using dialup to get on a buddies BBS - read it.

I loved it.  That said, I think a lot of that love stems from having been a geek who grew up in the 80's, without that I can imagine this book is a nostalgia trip that isn't relevant to you and therefore doesn't make any sense.  If you're like me though, it'll be right in your wheelhouse and you'll burn through it as quickly as you've read anything.

Great imaginative first half, with several interesting surprises.  But the last half is almost entirely predictable if you read a lot of fiction. There is a Willy Wonka vibe that, once you complete the novel, you will see what I mean.  It lends a "YoungAdult Lit" tone to the story that is fine, but it weakens the force of the conclusion too.

This was a great book if you like video games and the 80s. Some references were pretty obscure but it was fun to look them up or remember old pop culture references I forgot about. If your a gamer or a nerd you will really enjoy it. This book was incredibly fresh, well thought out and explored a concept with so much depth it felt like a real world.

A GREAT Popcorn novel. This is one of the great poporn novels of our generation. If you want a novel that immediately sucks you in, takes you on a great roller coaster ride, and let's you off after having consumed the book in one sitting, this book is for you. Whether you are nostalgic for the 80's and MTV or want to learn about it, read this book.
Fun, easy read, but insubstantial and often derivative sci-fi. As others have noted, this is geared for young adults, yet it's filled with '80's pop-culture references.

Instantly rose to a top five read for me. I felt like the author wrote the book for me, all things pop culture referenced in this book seemed to be near and dear to my heart and soul. And the references had their own flow based on level of popularity or applicability to the plot. Just a masterful debut book. I look forward to more from this author.
A great and fast read that has all the elements of a good novel.

On the recommendation of a colleague, I decided to give this a shot. From the very beginning of my read, it felt like a nostalgic romp through the 80s of my childhood. The games, music, and movies were all there. Add to that a very well done, captivating quest. A wonderful read for anyone who grew up in the 80s.
Entertaining, but predictable story.

This book felt like it was written specifically for me. Child of the 80s, growing up playing so many of the same games which are central to the plot, lover of 80s music; the fond memories Cline has for that decade shouts out of every page, and embedded in a brilliant plot the way it was... perfect.

I loved the idea behind this and the novel did not disappoint. But as much as I, a 40 year old, enjoyed it, I found it amazing that my 10 year old son heralded it as his favorite book (subject to change, of course). It's good. Really good. Clever writing that keeps you involved all the way through. Kudos.

...but an adventure of which my whole childhood seemed to be a part of the making. I would love to talk about it in detail but wouldn't dream of ruining this book for anyone. Just know this, if you're a fan of retro video games and 80s to 90s pop culture, this book had been finely tailored for you.
Worth reading. The equivalent of a summer blockbuster in book form: pretty satisfying grabbing and exciting, if a bit safe.

I could not put this book down. Part of me wanted to get to the end to see the outcome and part of me wanted it to last forever. Excellent writing, ingenious storyline. I will be recommending this book to everyone I know! Looking forward to more from Cline.
Nothing to get too excited about.  Even as a product of the 80s (graduated HS in 85) the references to the 80s were soooo numerous it seems to be trying to compensate for lack of strong writing.
ready player one is like a nerdy trip through the 80s meets the hunger games.  a good read.  recommended for all
Best read in a long time.
Read it, enjoy it. It's totally worth it and will leave you feeling great. Fun ride through the 80's. Do it

This was such a fun read! Were you a kid of the 70s/80s? Did you play a lot of video games on myriad computers and consoles? Do you like sci-fi, even just a little bit? How about 80s pop culture? Have I sold you yet? Read this book!
A nice trip through retro memory lane.
If you lived the 80s or are a big fan of them, or of gaming, music, movies,or anything to do with pop culture...you should read this book. It's lots of fun, and you'll be glad you did!

This story takes place in a dystopian future here on earth. The "real world" is so miserable to some, that they escape into a virtual world that has been created, called the OASIS. When the creator of this virtual world dies, he leaves behind all of his fortune to whomever can find the "Easter Egg" he has hidden somewhere inside the OASIS.  There are many keys to find and gates to discover in order to be the victor...The race is on, and it is quite a ride. I love the virtual world that is created, but the scary part is that I can see this as a possible future for us so easily; with the human love of technology and video games added to the desire to escape the real world. The author of this book definitely has an obsession with all things 80's, so if you are a fan too, you will love this book.  I did enjoy all the 80's pop culture references myself, but I think it would be an enjoyable read for anyone who loves sci-fi/mystery/adventure type stories...and if you're into cyperpunk stuff, then it's just an added bonus. I was a teenager during the 80's, but not much of a videogamer, then or now, and I still enjoyed it immensely. Definitely my favorite read this year, as well as an all time favorite.  This is a book I will read over and over again throughout the years!
This book is a lot of fun and brings back many memories from the 80's. I enjoyed the book from cover to cover.

Just read it. Seriously. If you grew up in the 80's. You will love it.  I stopped reading countless times to recall stories of the history, games, music, etc. mentioned in the book. Great job Earnest. Thank you.
Awesome read. I grew up in the 80's so I loved going back there through this book. Made me want to go back and watch all of the movies mentioned. Great writer and will be finding more from him.
Great story, couldn't put it down!  Futuristic, yet throws back  to the eighties to provide some familiar pop culture icons.
I would recommend it to those who grew up in the 1980's culture and the tech savoy kids of today it was a fun read
I really enjoyed this.  It was a captivating tale and as a child of the 80's, it brought back a lot of memories.  I look forward to more from Mr. Cline.
Very entertaining read.
awesome...just plain awesome!...I don't know what else to say. My favorite book by far, I'm praying for a sequel. That is all
I couldn't stop reading. Very addictive read. A lot of 80's references.

Highly imaginative book. Loved it and recommend it highly. If you remember the first video games, even more fun! Good v evil never gets old and this is a new take. Think Tron with a much better story and characters. Very well done!
This book blew my mind
Once you start reading you will no put it down until you finish it. Really puts the feelings and beliefs of gamers throughout the story.
I would recommend to any geek growing up in 80s. great use of 80s culture and icons throughout the book, while rooting for the little guy.
Entertaining throughout. Enjoyed the story line and deep characters. Recommend to anyone interested in a good read. 10 out of 10.
I really enjoyed the story. I've never been a gamer and still liked it! Love the references. Although, some things were quite predictable.
I couldn't put this book down. Truly entertaining and thrilling. I would recommend this read to everyone. It was very creative.

This is is the best fiction written in decades! A great story about corporate greed and virtual relationships that hardens back to the start of the video game revolution staged in the future Everquest and WoW made you think might be here by now.  You should buy it!
Fantastic story with more pop culture references than you can shake a stick at!
Read the whole book in one sitting. Could not put it down!
If you are a fan of fiction and the 80's this is a must read.  Very fun.
Very well done story with chuckle worthy references. Easily readable in one sitting and worth every minute. A must read for any nerd, geek, and or otaku.
An immersive experience that made me nostalgic and kept me reading. Highly recommend this book to anyone who love Sci fi, Monty Python, video games, or Rush.
My new fav book I reread the book twice in 3 months. If you are a video game fan an 80's fan the ready player one is for you.
Easy to follow. Creative
I absolutely loved this book. It was impossible to put down. Anyone who is a fan of the 80's will love this.
A FUN, fast paced adventure into a futuristic world using trivia from the past. A great summer read. Loved it.

Incredible book! Ernest Cline has the amazing ability to make even exposition interesting. There was never a moment where I was tempted to put it down or skip to a more interesting part. I consumed it in three days and then sat there wishing there was a sequel.
Great book although the dialog often seems childish relative to the author's obvious writing prowess, vision, and impressive knowledge of pop culture history.
Could not stop reading this book. I even got most of the reference s. Six more words are required, so.
Absolutely wonderful. Read this. Immediately. I cannot recommend this book any more. Read this right now. Right now. Drop everything, and read this. Thanks.

This book was great it kept me very interested and tons of '80s stuff as well in it. It talks about 2 of my favorite movies from that time period, it's 2045 but everything is related to the 80s! One of the best book I've ever read! Highly recommend it!
Split Infinity meets World of Warcraft meets 70's and 80's pop culture. I thoroughly enjoyed this book and highly recommended it.
,I was afraid the story would overdo the 80s references. It didn't.  The storyline did not rely on nostalgia and was a refreshing take on a virtual future. Highly recommended.

There isn't much to fault in this romp through a near future, which is packed with sympathetic characters, an immersive plot and thousands of eminently appropriate Easter eggs. Ready Player One is a celebration of contemporary and 80s geek culture, a well-balanced dystopian futurescape, and a solid coming-of-age novel; the combination should appeal to pretty much any reader.

This book was recommended by a friend. Growing up in the 70's and 80's and being a Arcade/Video Game junkie it was like a walk down memory lane. The book did a great job of blending old with current and looking into the future.

Even if you are not a gamer and working with the mind of a teenager, RP1 has a lot to offer in plot and concept. The story moves along at a brisk pace and the pop culture references of the 80's were a delight. As a geezer, I sometimes rolled my eyes from some of the dialog expressed by the adolescent characters dealing with the angst of youth, but of course, those sensibilities rang true to that generational mindset. Given the right director, this book would make a great movie...maybe even a trilogy.
the story kept me interested and the detail was impressive to me, having grown up in arcades in the 80's. the plot was a little Charlie and the Chocolate Factory but not bad for that.
This novel was a gripping adventure that was read in one day. Fantastic story! I recommend this book to every teenager willing to be exposed to a world of danger and life.
This book is incredible! Don't even think about it... Just read it! It doesn't matter if you don't get all of the references... Just have Wikipedia right next to you. It'll be an awesome trip.

I wanted to give this book 5 stars, but a few times in the middle it felt like I was taking a tedious trip down memory lane with the author. I still read the whole thing through and enjoyed every bit of it.
Do you still own an Atari 2600? Are you nostalgic for the 80's? This is the book for you my friends.
Like nothing I've ever read before.  I couldn't put it down.  You do not want to miss this book.  I promise

Ready Player One was not only a fantastic story, funny, suspenseful, tragic, etc., it was also a fun walk down memory lane.  Many summer afternoons of my adolescence were spent in Alladin's Castle, mostly watching my brother play but getting a few games of my own favorites in. Having grown up in the 80's, this story pushed a lot of buttons for me, but I hope other audiences appreciate it as well, because it's just a great read.
I couldn't put it down. Interesting ideas and very entertaining. Highly recommended.  It was a cool mix of the matrix and willy wonka and 80s pop culture.
Verify fun, loved the trip down memory lane in the 80s.
Couldn't put it down! A wonderful blend of fantasy, sci-fi, video games, and 80's pop culture, you'll watch Wargames with a new perspective!
As I never played D&D; as a teenager, I think I missed some of the references, but it was still alight and fun read.  Nothing great, not too much in the way of new sci-fi ideas
I enjoyed the journey this book takes you on and hope to see more from this author.  I will be reading anything else he writes and look forward to doing so

I downloaded this book at the same time as in by Neal Stephenson. At the end I thought, "who is this Cline guy?" I totally thought I'd been reading something as good as Cryptonomicon and was reading Stephenson.
A real page turner, couldn't put it down in the end. for those who are fans of 80s pop culture, sci-fi and fantasy this has it all.
Fun read!  Will make a great movie.  Now I want to go watch John Hughes movies and play asteroids and defender.

I enjoyed this book. At times it was a little too geeky for me and the beginning was a little slow getting started (due to the character literally explaining how the OASIS system works) but it picked up and ended up being a pretty interesting plot. I also appreciated that the characters were genuine and I was rooting for them by the end (even though some of their nostalgic references seemed slightly forced).

Charming, insightful, thrilling and a complete 80's fest. As a person obsessed with all things music, movie, and game related this story was a treat (with 'real' life lesson thrown in). I highly recommend the audiobook version of it too, Wil Wheaton's reading of it is superb.
It's very simple and fun to read.  It get a little predictable at times, but overall it's thrilling.  The ending is terrible.
I really enjoyed this book.  Well written and it holds your interest from beginning to end.  I look forward to seeing more from the author.
This was truly one of the best books I've ever read if not the best. I wholeheartedly recommend this book to any and every gamer out there.

If you were a teenager in the 80s, this book is for you. If you have any interest in video games, computers, adventure, music, television, love, then this book is for you. I might even read this again. You must read it.

What a great book.  I was totally engrossed from the first word.  Mr. Clone does a fantastic job of telling such a won fearful story in only 375 pages.  Bravo sir!  My regret is that is that the book had to end.

Cline has brought to us a wonderful display of nerd wisdom and knowledge. Every page and every chapter was filled with rich dialogue and fantastic referencing. I couldn't stop reading and enjoyed every moment of this book. I wish that the OASIS is real yes, but I also saw such relevance in knowing that this life we live can be so beautiful and endearing. It is not only about the people we play with online, but the lifetime friendships that are created regardless of the distance we may share. Thank you Ernest Cline, live long and prosper.
This is one of the best books I've read lately. Excellent character development and a delightfully nerdy story that speaks to my generation
Very enjoyable book. It was very much a blast from the past.  I actually thought it was gong to be a pop nostalgia book. I didn't realize it was a novel.  I liked it a lot.
Great story for anyone, but if you grew up in 1980s video arcades you'll grin with flashbacks the whole way through!

Once you get past the novelty of the 80s/gamer theme (which is undoubtedly what drew you to this book in the first place), there really isn't much to this book.  The characters are dull, flat, and unimaginative. Self-conscious girl meets boy ignored by girls, and they eventually end up together?  Evil villain works for a faceless evil corporation?  Never read that one before!  Still, if the 80s/gamer culture is your jam, this is an enjoyable read.  Just don't expect much more than that.
I couldn't put the book down. It reminded me so much of my life as kid growing up during the 80's. And yes, it would make a great movie.
Excellent!  Living in San Francisco in the 70s I remember all the early computers, even taught computers at Bridgemont High.  Loved the book!
I love this book. I can't stop re-reading it. It's just a lot of fun, reminds me of so many great 80s things, and it's a coming of age story.
I couldn't put this book down. I used all the free time I had to read it  even if it was 10 minutes at a time and thoroughly enjoyed it.
I was hooked after the first paragraph and became engrossed in the story immediately. Any one brought up on early computer gaming who remembers the 80s will love this tale.
Fantastic read! Any old school gamer will appreciate this Sci-Fi adventure novel! You won't be disappointed if you read this!
I am not a gamer, so I did tend to skim over parts of this book, but I really enjoyed the story and the characters. I also liked the dystopian message that is given.
This book is just amazing it opened my eyes i cant stop reading it. I want to read like 10 times. GREATEST BOOK I EVER READ!
Thoroughly enjoyable read, especially if you are a gamer & a child of the 80's (you'll get all of the in jokes).

I just loved this book. Totally fantastic. Will have to wait until I am off the kindle to type up detailed thoughts. for now, I loved that the book both adhered to, and also subverted, video game and virtual reality tropes. Also it is not clear that the outside is a good place. Great plot driven adventure, stepped in nostalgia, but the novel leaves some open questions.

I am not a science fiction person. I really liked Ender's Game, for example, but otherwise, they are rarely my thing. But this was an excellent book for me. I feel there are two types of amazon reviews, people who write long detailed reviews, and others, like this one, who will just rate the book. Sorry if you were looking for a longer review. I feel the blurb about the book tells you what the story is, I am telling you, that story was done well in my opinion.
This is my favorite book! I highly recommend this to everyone! The whole plot is so interesting and it makes you want to play in the OASIS.

I felt like I was jacked into the OASIS reading this.  Thank you to Joe Vance and "Bear" Theobold for recommending.  This is the story of every geek, freak, and nerd who has to go online to feel accepted.  The references were wonderful but the romance between wade and Sam was the real hook.  way to go

I am not anything close to a gamer or a computer geek at all. Yet, I really loved this book. The whole concept of this book was just SO fascinating to me!! And there were experiences the main character went through that I thought would be so cool if it could actually happen to me. While I didn't get every 80's reference or even know anything about most of the games being played, it still sucked me in and completely fascinated me. And even though he told us at the beginning the outcome of the end, I was still sweating it as he explained HOW it ends. It was so different than any book I've read. I would definitely recommend!!

Not my usual read but it was recommended and I thought it was a fun read. The book takes place in the future when the planet is at it's worst and virtual reality is the place to be. The creator of the next great "video" system Oasis has died. Without anyone to leave his fortune to he has spent the last 15 years of his life creating the ultimate game. The person who finds Halliday's "egg" wins his fortune. Halliday's favorite era was the 80's and players have to learn a lot to solve his puzzles in order to pass through each gate in the game. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 was that I felt some places got a little dry....giving more background details than really needed but overall a good, fun read.
I think back to my childhood and playing the games of this book and I have  so many fond memories of sleepless nights with cheetos and mountain dew. Read this book and revel in the past!

The book was decent, light and easy reading. But it seemed to not keep with the 80s theme the whole way through which bothered me. You start to get a feeling that the author just wanted to include all the stuff he liked growing up
Ready Player One is a great, quick read.  Love the 80's and 90's nostalgia.  Sorry was exciting and overall enjoyable.
I really enjoyed this!  And I will encourage my kids to read it, also.  I hope to read more by this authour.
A very smooth, easy read that keeps you guessing and wanting more. I found myself getting up early to get a chapter in before work or reading late into the night. Sequel? Yes please.

Brought tears to my eyes several times as I was reminded of things I did as a kid with my best friend who passed away last year far too young. It's not just about 80s nostalgia and not manipulative or fake like some reviewers claim. You had to be there, be close to my age to properly appreciate this book. My friend loved Rush, it was his favorite band. We played Black Tiger every day after school in 1988. We played Adventure. He lived in Oregon like Og after we grew up and parted ways. The 80s stuff isn't gratuitous, it's the story. While reading I couldn't decide if Halliday and Og were caricatures of Carmack and Romero or Jobs and Woz. Maybe both, Carmack and Woz. I'm not sure if this is really a great book for general consumption by non-gamers. I do wish those who don't get it would stop reading rather than sharing inane reviews. I loved it. Very emotional and exciting read.
Great book for anyone that grew up in the 80's playing Dungeons and Dragons and video games. I could not stop reading intil I finished it.
Thousands of books read and I will never forget this one.  Stands with all the classics--no one has nailed the advent of the video game age like this...

This book starts out awkward. It builds and the writing gets better as it goes .  It feels like two different people worked on it as there are two writing styles .  Lots of '80s lore , video game history and dystopian future with some virtual reality thrown in.

At first I couldn't put this book down, then about half way through I just lost interest. Yes, I wanted to know what happened and who each player was, but I didn't care anymore how they got to that point. All the powers and magic and weapons were just over the top. It just seemed to drag and just got a bit over the top. However, I will say I loved the concept of the book, it was definitely unique and well thought out.
It's like reading a geek focused encyclopedia of awesomeness! A fantastic book for anyone that grew up in the 80's.
Are you a gamer? Remember esoteric details of a games story line? This book has them and it's all part of a great story!
Great read. Fun and exciting. The writing is simple enough that it doesn't require a lot of thought. A good afternoon read!!

A strange dystopian sci-fi world in which a virtual reality simulation has replaced real life for most people . . . and a contest to claim control over the whole thing, programmed by someone who grew up with popular culture from the 1980s, hence it is a world founded on 80s pop culture . . . This book is fairly well-written, and fun, but the biggest thrill for me was that the game in the book is sort of a metaphor for the book itself - full of "easter egg" references to 80s popular (and geek) culture - and since I grew up in the 80s myself, there is the added thrill of this book "speaking my language" . . . if you don't remember the 80s, or don't remember the 80s fondly, you may not like this book. But if you were an 80s geek like me . . . this is probably a book for you!
Although not a literary epic this book really held my interest and I'm a mom who has never played video games. It was a fast read and I really enjoyed it.

Wow, Ready Player One kind of blew my mind. It's all about fun in this one, and honestly, anyone who would outright give it a bad review is someone I'm not interested in hearing from. Is there no room for FUN anymore!? Anyways, the novel is basically a world of warcraft on steroids in a future earth ruined by pollution where a poor, nobody high school kid hunts down a golden egg by way of 80's trivia. That's literally the premise. There should be more stories like this out there, not trying to be super dramatic or literary, but just fun as hell to read.
I look forward to more from this author. it was hard to put down once i started it. if you like SiFi i recommend this

I honestly can't remember the last time I had fun just reading a story before READY PLAYER ONE. Not only was it an engaging tale (not necessarily the most unique, but I don't really care) of Wade's quest to find the egg, it was just littered with all sorts of references to classic 80s movies and video games, which had me giggling a bit every time it mentioned something I recognized. I'd recommend this to anyone who's a die hard fan of classic text based and arcade video games, or to anyone who just wants to have a bit of fun--it's just a great read!
I read this in a little more than a day. It's almost impossible to put down. Tons of fun for video game and sci-fi nerds, and has more heart and the usual pulp novel.

What a fun, ingenious book. The references to all the geeky, and nerd culture made me laugh.  I love the last gate! The way it was played out was perfect, and the whole bit was a nail biter. Thanks for a new and unique book.
Enjoyable high tech scavenger hunt for nerds who were kids of the 80s.  Typical dystopian sci-fi future romp with a young protagonist.  Predictable but lots of fun.
if you love video games, anime or just pop culture. this us the perfect read for you! especially if you love mmos
I really enjoyed this book. I liked the imagery I was able to conjure on my own. Can't wait to see hollywoods version...
There's not one thing I'd change in this book. The geek references were dead on. Geezer Wheaton was one of my favorite bits. Great characters and pacing.

A recommendation from a friend, this book ended up sucking me in pretty quickly. The obsequious references to 80's video game culture started to wear on me after a while, but Mr. Cline's imaginative and very descriptive take on a dystopian future escaping real life through virtual reality simulations was pretty believable.

I ran into a woman reading this and I asked her what it was about. She was only a couple of chapters into it but she said I really should read it. It centers around a bleak future were anyone that can avoids reality in a giant video game. The creator of the game, just before his death, announces a contest with the winner receiving all his wealth. The fun part is the creator of the game bases most of the challenges on information from the 1980's. The adventure is fun and the information about the 80's is nostalgic. That chance encounter with the reader was really fortunate.
One of the best books I have read in a long time.  Well worth the price.  The world is dynamic and the characters feel solid.

Loved this book - lots of nostalgia in there, really fun to go back and watch/read/play all the references. Without giving away too much, I didn't find much in the character development that lead me to believe the protagonist was capable of conceiving and executing on such a bold strategy. But as he is mainly the vehicle for the story, I didn't have too much trouble just enjoying the journey.

This is the book for the gaming addict, for the dystopian lover, for the underdog supporter, for the hidden 80s fan. Never again will you feel more at home than when you open this book. It's the home we've all been searching for.
Recommended by a friend i had severe difficulty putting it down until i had finished it, a triumph of a novel.
Not for Wow. This was an excellent book. Well written. Being a teen in the '80s this brought back very many fond memories. thanks mr. Cline. I look forward to other books.
Excellent 80s flashback.  It is interesting to see ones youth presented from a future perspective.  It is a nice quick read with a lot of 80s memories tossed in.

I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked this book. The prologue was a smidge long, but once the story (game) began, it was an easy read. It was pretty hyped up as a "must read" for any child of the 1980's. I can certainly see why, and I also disagree slightly. I would probably have to claim the 1980's as my formative years since I finished high school before the end of that decade. I am just not very nostalgic for a lot of it, and frankly some of it should be completely forgotten (high waisted pants worn with cropped tops, Frankie Goes to Hollywood...). For me, the charm of the story was the narrator. His survival instinct, his cheeky confidence that he could win this amazing contest, and his overall decency . The challenge of the game was fun and kept me engaged from the beginning. I think the 1980's trivia was a prop for the game and as such was very effective, but without the characters playing the game it would just be trivia.
So many references. A classic battle. Good versus evil. A true hero. It's all here. What I want to know is, how could a single game designer developer be that good ???

If you like The Goldberg's and know what that means, then you'll love this homage to 80's gaming, movies and tech.This book will likely not be a favorite of those who don't identify with gamers or gaming, thus the title.
A good read.  If you like the 80s, uncomfortable romance and virtual action, jump in!  I'd recommend reading, I also enjoyed Making Monsters by Joe Turk, both good.

It was like I was re-living so many of my favorite things I the 1980's. The book is well written and a fun read, especially for anyone who remembers the 80's and happens to enjoy video games. Best quick, fun book I've read in at least 15 years!
Read it in 3 days, it makes you wonder about the future, and alternate realities, reminding you to live to the fullest.

I'm late to reading this book obviously as it took me 2 years after I bought it to finally read it.  Nevertheless, I thought it was a great book.  As a child of the 80's, all the references made sense and really brought me back.  I can't really think of something I didn't like but if I had too, I guess I'd like to have an epilogue in the story.
Good adventure. Could not put it down. First book of Clines that I've read. Going to see what other books he's written
This book was a pleasure to read. I connected with the characters, felt what they felt, and loved the story! The details were amazing: very imaginative, creative, and fun!
Made me remember of all those great futuristic SF novels I used to read as a child. I am already looking forward to the movie adoption of this book; I hope they do it well.

I enjoyed this book a lot! not only the version of the future is great and fun, but the story is very good and keeps you wanting to read the next chapter. This is the kind of book that deserves going to Hollywood.

This book is awesome!  A retro-sci-fi novel with adventure, geeky-ness and classic david v goliath stoylines.  I'm not one for WOW'ing or any other viedo games for that matter, but I found the story and plot completely engrossing and fun.  I look forward to the author's next book!
This book is fantastic. Exciting quick read. Hoping a sequel comes along soon. Ready player one is a must read

As a lover of video games and all things 80's this book seemed like a cant miss prospect for me. It did hit, but it also missed a lot as well. Maybe the book had just been too hyped up for me but I found myself disappointed with almost every aspect of the book from writing to story structure to characters. A good book don't get me wrong, but not the "holy crap most amazing freaking awesome book ever" that I heard so many people describe it as.
Well written, fun, with lots of 80 references. I thoroughly enjoyed this book. Like your favorite junk food, probably not good for you, but delicious. I'll exercise my brain with Vonnegut tomorrow.

I ended up audio-booking this and was quite wonderful. Wil Wheaton narrating was awesome, the plot kept me engaged the ENTIRE time. I first got it to listen to on the way to and from work everyday. Needless to say most of the time listening was done while relaxing at home.

If you grew up in the 80s and enjoy video games, this novel is for you!  Not just a blast from the past, but an action packed adventure that quickly picks up pace and makes you want to read straight through to the end.
A wonderful Page burner. For anyone who has ever called him or herself a nerd, this book is right up your alley.

I really enjoyed the imaginative approach to this book and all the cultural references from the 80s when I grew up. The book is also smart and sincere  and fresh. It was such a fun read i breezed through it very quickly. Enjoy!

I enjoy a bit more action in my books and maybe a little less "God hating". But other than that it was a new idea that resonated with todays addictions and the writer really kept you guessing, not so much as to who would win but how. The twists and turns and the genius of the heroin was very fun to read. I fully enjoyed the book and would recommend it to anyone looking for something new.
Great book, wish there were more in a series or similar books, there just aren't many like this.  I especially loved all the 80's references.

I have always enjoyed books that are, shall we say, eclectic.  Escape From Kathmandu, Popco, most of Terry Pratchett's work, etc.  I had fun reading this book and strolling down memory lane via the 80's references.

Wow. All I can say is wow. Wow. Ok, maybe I can say more. Being an adult that grew up in the 80s, I can't tell you how many times I was busting out a huge grin for a reference to all the great memories the author brought back. A must read for any nerd, geek or fan of science fiction. Well played sir, well played! Thank you very much!

As a child of the 80s I can't begin to describe how much I loved this book. I "forced" my 16 year old son to read it, and being a gamer, he is now enjoying it on a whole other level. It's truly a book you don't want to out down!
Awesome. Spellbinding and nostalgic in one fast paced plot. The main characters are people you want to meet on real life.
This book was a very quick read and caught my attention. Lots of detail which makes everything easy to picture.

Inside this ageing  female grey gamer, a teenage geek boy nerd lurks. And this book completely fulfilled the desire to step into another world, or worlds, aligning fantasy with reality. Absolutely loved it, and abandoned my own life in order to fulfil the quest along with Parsival.
I loved all the 80's references! It was like watching a movie the writing was so descriptive, I could picture everything so clearly!
Ernest Cline has crafted two richly detailed, engaging, imaginative worlds: the "real" world and the one inside the OASIS. I found Ready Player One to be every bit as addicting as the OASIS (haha).

I thoroughly enjoyed being caught up completely in this story! Great characters and conflict in a technical setting that exploits the human condition, Cline presents a dystopia that is expansive, not choking. I find I'm circling back, wanting more. Terrific reading even for non-gamers like me.

This book really does a lot to service pop culture junkies. The book does an excellent job setting up the setting of the book and Oasis that exists inside it. Really does excellent job explaining the rules of Oasis. Really hard to put down once you begin.
If you were alive in the 80s, you will probably have a blast reading this book. A lot of fun to read.

This book was recommended by another author, I can't remember his name. I was intrigued by the subject matter. I'm an eighties child so this brought back memories. I loved it. But I think anyone who wasn't born in the seventies, won't enjoy it, they won't understand it.
Ready Player One is a must read for any tech geek.  Further, This was an adventure fit for a movie.

This is a pretty good book... I have no big interest in video games or the 80s however I love science fiction and the author wrote this so well that I couldn't put the book down and also made me want to play all my boyfriends ps4 games... this is a very well written, very addicting sci fi thriller that also includes corporation conspiracy which I'm always a fan of

Just about every corner of this book/world was intriguing to me. It became "very real" at one point and my nightly page reading doubled, read it, you'll know what I mean. I'm at a very busy time in life, reading takes a back seat to just about everything, this was welcome relief the bit I got in each night. I don't reivew much but if you are slightly into tech, games, or just about anything geek of the last 30 years, you will enjoy this book. The reveal near the end, I can relate to in my tech life. Even now, I know so many, I've never really seen or met in the meatspace. That's my review, Read it! Enjoy it you will. -=D

I had to turn around and read this a 2nd time to digest all the detailed 80's trivia.  Really a great read and a unique distopian story that might be a little dated from a technology perspective but has good character development and a few good twists and turns.
I was looking for more books by this author after finishing Ready Player One, but looks like I'll have to wait till 2015 for his second book.

If you were a child of the 80's then this is going to be an even better read than I could possibly describe. I must have said "OMG I totally forgot about that" a million times. Reading it on a tablet allows you to google the items throughout the book while you read.  Tons of fun!

Highly recommend this book for any and all ages. I just couldn't put it down and read it faster than about any other book i have read. The author paints a great picture and i just felt like i was IN this story with the characters.

This is a readable quasi-romance that transpires for the most part in the "Oasis", a virtual reality world inhabited by a vast number of the world's populace disappointed by the bleak society of the future.  The central plot focuses on our teen aged protagonist's hunt for the "egg" hidden in the Oasis by its now dead founder, which requires a deep knowledge of the Founder's personal passions-80s pop culture and video games.  For aficionados of those narrow areas, THIS IS YOUR BOOK.  For the rest of us, the plotting, virtual reality details, and the trials and tribulations of the narrowly drawn characters are barely sufficient to compel reading to the inevitable yet somewhat unsatisfying conclusion.
Great story and concept that got better as the story continued.  Made me happy to be a child of the 80's!
I took me quite a long time before I got wind of this book, and that's the only negative thing I could think to say.  Love this!

I liked it, but I wish it had me more on the edge of my seat. It's a treasure trove for 80's trivia enthusiasts, but it lacks in the area of a great storyteller to really capture the reader and keep them riveted to the end. Not sure if there is any way around this, but I felt I was reading a kids/young adult book. This is at odds with the audience the book will attract. Being a geek of the 80's, I am now 40. Personally I would have liked it to be written with a higher rating in mind.

Many people focus on the romp through '80 nostalgia, and that was certainly a lot of fun. However, this book is excellent for many more reasons; characters, plot, pace, and excellent story-telling! You'll enjoy it most if you were a geek in the '80's--like me--but even if you weren't you'll find something to like about this book.
Don't miss out on this one. Couldn't put it down. Do yourself a favor and read this book. You won't be disappointed.
The references to old games and movies was very original. I love the writing style and the suspense was good too.

This is easily one of the best books I've had the pleasure of reading in a long time. All of the characters felt familiar from the beginning, and were easy to identify with. The deftly written narrative grabbed me by the sleeve, and sprinted to its deeply satisfying finish. Five stars.
This was a great read. I enjoyed the walk down memory lane as I remembered a number of the references from my childhood. The story was a good smooth read.
